result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan Michael McMillan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If revoked, defendant shall pay court costs as previously ordered.

Defendant shall complete a certified batter's program. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed. 
Defendant shall submit to random, observed testing for alcohol and controlled substances upon request of law enforcement, DOC, or designee.
Defendant shall be employed full time or seek work at a rate of 3 job applications per week and provide documentation to DOC monthly.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall complete a certified batter's program. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed. 
Defendant shall submit to random, observed testing for alcohol and controlled substances upon request of law enforcement, DOC, or designee.
Defendant shall be employed full time or seek work at a rate of 3 job applications per week and document monthly with DOC.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant shall report on or before 2pm on October 28, 2022.
Work release granted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan Michael McMillan

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jordan Michael McMillan in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Jordan Michael McMillan.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant will plead to charge. State will recommend 5 years WSPS (3in and 2out) to be stayed and impose 3 years probation with the following conditions: complete a certified batterer's program, counseling that DOC deems appropriate, submit to random observed drug testing, 1 year jail time, maintain full time employment or seek 3 applications per week and document with DOC, and court costs. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Court reviews rights lost due to felony conviction. State heard. Attorney Bartelt heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 5 years WSPS (3in and 2out) to be stayed and court imposes 3 years probation with the following conditions: complete a certified batterer's program, to have such assessment, counseling, treatment, and programming that DOC deems appropriate, not to possess or consume any alcohol, not to possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed, submit to random, observed testing for alcohol and controlled substances upon request on law enforcement, DOC, or designee, to pay court costs, to be employed full time or seek 3 applications a week and document with DOC, and to serve 1 year in jail, with work release, to report Oct. 28 at 2pm with 9 days credit.

ADDRESS INFO for Jordan Michael McMillan
Current: 1014 W Bluff St, Cassville, WI 53806   (Effective: 10-12-2022)
Prior: 418 E. Amelia St., Cassville, WI 53806
Status conference on October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jordan Michael McMillan in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Jordan Michael McMillan.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bartelt heard on the status of case and is requesting a continuance.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jordan Michael McMillan in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Jordan Michael McMillan.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bartelt files Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing with the Court. Court reviews document with defendant and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives right to preliminary hearing. Court binds matter over. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on June 20, 2022 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Jordan Michael McMillan in court.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for SPD because they need to verify information. Defendant was not able to obtain information that SPD was requesting because he was incarcerated. Defendant to go to SPD to see what information they still need and to provide it to them. Victim contacted court and requests no contact dropped. Court modifies bond to remove no contact with victim condition. Court finds good cause to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Status as to counsel set.
Status conference on June 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Jordan Michael McMillan appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. State requests $500 cash bond with a condition not to contact Victim #1. Defendant heard on bond. Court heard and orders $500 cash bond with a condition not to have any contact with Victim #1. Status date set.
Defendant shall not have any contact with N.M.
